Clean it up

by: Pete Phinney
by: Pete Phinney
March 13, 2021

If we all could make just a tiny bit more effort and not leave our human waste on the ground or in the water...carry an emergency toilet option while traveling: Dry John toilet bags. Just put the bag in a container and you’ve got your own toilet. Any container 5 gallons or less, even a small cardboard box will work!

Dry John toilet bags are designed to be kind to nature. Our bags are compostable. The media inside the bag is organic and helps solidify human waste. Human waste in a solid form is easier to transport and carry out. Human waste is better deposited in a lined landfill than scattered about the ground or deposited in the water. Can you help us help nature?

The Huron Lighthouse - built in 1939

click to visit

March 18, 2021

Built in 1939, the Huron, Ohio lighthouse construction resembles that of ships built at the time, with riveted steel connections. It’s taken a pounding over the decades and still looks great and solid! Picture taken at dawn on 3/18/21.
